required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Hydrolyzed Collagen and Vitamin C on Explosive Performance
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Hydrolyzed Collagen and Vitamin C on Explosive Performance

brief_summary.textblock: Determine whether supplementation with a combined dose of 20 g of hydrolyzed collagen and 50 mg vitamin C, along with a power training exercise program, increases rate of force development (RFD) and performance in athletes

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Sealed opaque packets coded by Sponsor's Product Development

primary_outcome.measure: Maximal rate of force development (RFD) of isometric squat (MIS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3
primary_outcome.description: Force (N) over time (msec) for the maximum slope of the first 20% of the movement

primary_outcome.measure: Counter-movement jump (CMJ) rate of force development (RFD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3

primary_outcome.measure: Squat jump height rate of force development (RFD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3

other_outcome.measure: Maximum peak force of maximal isometric squat (MIS)
other_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3
% change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3
other_outcome.description: Jump performance max N/s/kg (Note: Eccentric is the drop down part of the CMJ)

other_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3
other_outcome.description: Jump performance max N/s/kg (Note: Concentric is the movement upwards of the CMJ)

other_outcome.time_frame: % change from baseline to week 1, week 2 and week 3

arm_group.arm_group_label: Hydrolyzed collagen and Vitamin C powder mix
arm_group.description: 20 g hydrolyzed collagen + 50 mg vitamin C (ascorbic acid) pre-packed powder diluted in 250 ml (8 oz) of water
20 g maltodextrin pre-packed powder diluted in 250 ml (8 oz) of water

intervention.intervention_name: Collagen and Vitamin C powder mix nutritional intervention
intervention.description: 20 g collagen + 50 mg vitamin C daily, 60 min prior to exercise
intervention.arm_group_label: Hydrolyzed collagen and Vitamin C powder mix

intervention.description: 20 g maltodextrin placebo daily, 60 min prior to exercise

Explosive/power-based exercise training program 3 times/week at home consisting of drop jumps, box jumps, weighted jump squats loaded in a progressive manner weekly for 3 weeks. At baseline and at the end of each of the 3 weeks, measures of explosive performance are assessed in the lab (maximal isometric squat, counter-movement jump and squat jump)
intervention.arm_group_label: Hydrolyzed collagen and Vitamin C powder mix

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy male athletes between 18-30 years of age
2. Currently participating in sport
3. <3 musculoskeletal injuries in the past year
4. No health or dietary restriction that would be affected by the supplementation protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of more than 3 musculoskeletal injuries within the past 12 months
2. Health, dietary restriction or diet that would be affected by the supplementation protocol
3. Willing to eat similar dietary pattern the day before baseline testing and each exercise testing/intervention day

eligibility.gender_description: Collagen synthesis varies significantly throughout the menstrual cycle in females. This natural variation would confound the study. Provided this work proves successful, we will aim to perform similar studies in females.

facility.name: UC Davis Functional Molecular Biology Laboratory and Human Performance Laboratory
